Noisy Brewing Co. 0 Skip to Content Brewery & Taproom Menu About Shop Contact Open Menu Close Menu Brewery & Taproom Menu About Shop Contact Open Menu Close Menu Brewery & Taproom Menu About Shop Contact Noisy Brewing Co is a micro brewery & taproom in Ōtepoti Dunedin. “Noisy Brewing Co. is a boutique brewing company making waves in the Dunedin beer scene. Small and nimble, with an experimental and innovative output by owner Chris Noye, who loves nothing more than concocting a new brew.” Read More… Where you’ll find us. Our family friendly taproom is located across the road from the railway station carpark, down the drive beside Ironic cafe & bar. There’s plenty of parking, indoor and outdoor seating and a delicious bar menu courtesy of our amazing neighbours at Ironic. All of our own beer is brewed onsite, and you can sit next to our tanks which are constantly bubbling away with our latest brews. We’ve got plenty of space for wheelchairs and prams, as well as accessible bathrooms and a change table for the wee ones. We have high chairs & colouring books for the kids, all the tomato sauce a kiwi kid could want, as well as a few games and colouring books for the adults. Dunedin Brewery - Beer Home Beer Food Live Music Calendar Info Merch Home Beer Food Live Music Calendar Info Merch Handcrafted Ale & Lager Award Winning Beers since 1996 Our brews are hand-crafted in small batches, 14 barrels at a time, by our small collective of brewers. Much of our production supplies our Tasting Room—on premise—while we also ship kegs out to bars and restaurants in the Tampa Bay area through Craft Beer Distributors, Inc. If you are a Bar Manager who is interested in pouring Dunedin Brewery products in your establishment, please e-mail us Here . Handcrafted Ale & Lager Our downtown tasting room features 12 taps at our main bar plus 6 more in the Moon Tower. We offer pours by the 5oz, 12oz, & 16oz pour. We also do beer samplers for first-time visitors looking to try numerous offerings before settling on a proper pour. If you're looking for an up to date menu, you're just gonna have to come belly up to the bar. We prefer to leave you surprised. Here are a few you are likely to encounter on most visits: • Apricot Peach Ale • American Classic IPA • AIR Lager • BOP! Dunedin Brewery - Live Music Calendar Home Beer Food Live Music Calendar Info Merch Home Beer Food Live Music Calendar Info Merch Concerts & Events ***All Music Events are Free Admission Unless Otherwise Noted*** Dunedin Brewery is a staple of the live music scene in Tampa Bay, hosting a fusion of up and coming touring regional acts along with support for local talent. Since it began in the mid 2000s, our Wednesday Night Open Jam has become a staple of the Tampa Bay music scene--known for spawning new successful bands. Fridays & Saturday evenings find both local and touring musicians on one of our two stages. Wrap up the weekend with Sunday Service , an afternoon session outdoors when weather permits. We also host a few mini-music festivals including Oktobeerfest , Spring Beer Jam , Joe Marcinek's Snowbird Jamboree, & more. All music & entertainment is booked in-house. If you are interested in performing at Dunedin Brewery, all inquiries must be sent to mailto:talent@dunedinbrewery.com Sep 10 Wednesday Night Open Jam Wednesday, September 10 @ 7:30PM Wed, Sep 10 @ 7:30PM Come jam with our house band and other local musicians! Fueled by sincere passion for making people move and strong desire to entertain, it is hard to find something not to like about these guys who speak nice and easy in person, too. With singer/keyboardist K. Sahagian, singer/bassist Brendon Porter, and drummer Jack Clements, this group delivers the right mix of classic style, well-developed musicianship, and a sunny disposition that is winning over fun-loving fans of all ages. Share Clave Cafe Band Friday, September 26 @ 8:00PM Fri, Sep 26 @ 8:00PM Clave Café is a bold new Latin Jazz ensemble that pushes the boundaries of musical fusion,
blending the infectious rhythms of Afro-Cuban music, the passion of Rumba Flamenca, and the
raw energy of rock.
The group features Emiliano Peraza (bass), Kenny Ugando (percussion), Craig Polito
(drums), and Carlos Rodriguez (guitar & vocals) — a dynamic mix of American and Latin
artists. Each member brings unique influences, weaving together diverse musical landscapes.
With roots in jazz, flamenco, and Latin traditions, Clave Café is redefining what it means to
explore cross-cultural collaboration. Their sound is a vibrant journey through rhythm, melody,
and soul — celebrating cultural exchange while experimenting with bold, innovative textures.
From explosive improvisations to intricate grooves, every performance is a fresh, electrifying
take on global music traditions, where each note tells a story of unity, creativity, and musical
adventure. Share Blueprint + DJ Detox w/ Jon Ditty Sunday, September 28 @ 6:00PM Sun, Sep 28 @ 6:00PM HIP HOP on a Sunday with BLUEPRINT, DJ DETOX, & and opening set by Jon Ditty. Our contact centre takes calls 24 hours a day, seven days a week all year round. Urgent or immediate matters If you need to report an urgent matter that is causing an immediate risk to the safety of people or property call us on +64 3 477 4000 so we can act quickly. Report a problem Use our online fix it form to report a non-urgent problem such as water leaking onto a footpath, a pot hole or broken DCC signage. Report a problem General feedback If you want to give us a compliment, make a complaint or give us some general feedback let us know using our general feedback form. General feedback Customer Service Centre Come see us at our Customer Service Centre which is located on the ground floor of the Civic Centre. 50 The Octagon, Dunedin . Our opening hours are 8.30am to 5pm Monday, Tuesday, Thursday and Friday. We open half an hour later on Wednesday, opening hours are 9am to 5pm. You can also call us on +64 3 477 4000 or email dcc@dcc.govt.nz . The contact centre operates 24 hours a day, seven day a week for urgent matters involving noise, dogs, water and waste, and roading. If you are deaf, hard of hearing, deaf-blind or have a speech impediment, the New Zealand Relay Service can assist you with calling us. Get in-person building and planning advice Experts from our Building and Planning teams are available at Customer Services in the Civic Centre from 9am – 5pm, Monday – Friday. There’s no need to make an appointment – just drop in when it suits you. Other service centres You can also visit one of our other service centres at the following locations to make a payment, register your dog or speak to a member of staff about another service we may be able to assist with. Service centre Location Opening hours Blueskin Bay Service Centre 28 Harvey Street, Blueskin Bay Monday to Friday 11am - 1pm and 2pm - 5pm Mosgiel Service Centre 7 Hartstonge Avenue, Mosgiel Monday to Friday 9.30am - 5pm Port Chalmers Service Centre Cnr Beach and Grey Street, Port Chalmers Monday to Friday 9.30am - 5pm South Dunedin Community Pop-up 199 Hillside Road, South Dunedin Tuesday and Thursday 11am - 4pm Wednesday and Friday 11am - 5pm Waikouaiti Service Centre 192 Main Road, Waikouaiti Monday to Friday 11am - 5pm Dunedin Public Libraries Find the locations and opening hours of the local libraries and book bus on the Dunedin Public Libraries website . Media enquires If you’re a media representative seeking information or comment on Dunedin City Council, our Communications team is available to assist you. Please contact our Communications team at comms@dcc.govt.nz . Official information request The Dunedin City Council is committed to promoting openness and transparency in all its dealings and makes a large amount of information available through its website. If you cannot find the information you want on this website, you can make a formal request for information under the Local Government Official Information and Meetings Act 1987 (LGOIMA). Request information Still didn't find what you were looking for? JobDun Business support Business clinic Dunedin business networks Starting up Industry Hub Enterprise Dunedin Toolkit & resources Dunedin NZ Visual Library Live Meet Screen Study Visit Insiders Dunedin Home Visit Eat & Drink Breweries and Bars In this section In this section See & do Accommodation Shop Dunedin Get there Around & about Dunedin isite Visitor Centre Autumn in Dunedin #Dunnerstunner Summer Spring in Dunedin Summer in Dunedin Nature Visitor info Winter in Dunedin Current travel information Eat & Drink Breweries and Bars Artisan Producers Restaurants Seafood Cafes Local's Picks Food Trucks Vege and Vegan Indulgent International Flavours Camping Summer in Dunedin: Sorted Autumn in Dunedin: Sorted Dunedin Breweries Emerson's Brewery Richard Emerson started brewing beer in his student flat. These days Emerson's Brewery churns out up to 15,000 litres of premium craft beer five days a week at their swanky premises just a stone's throw from Forsyth Barr Stadium. With a fabulous restaurant on site, and guided tastings and brewery tours available, a visit to Emerson's is a must-do for beer lovers. 70 Anzac Ave Speight's Brewing in Dunedin since 1876 and fed by a natural spring beneath the site, Speight’s is one of the few gravity-fed breweries left in the world. Take in a brewery tour and then pop next door to the Alehouse restaurant for a Tasting Tray, expertly matched with the menu, should you fancy a bite. Fresh spring water is available from the Speight's tap outside too, join the queue and fill your bottle. 200 Rattray St Arc Brewing Co. This small family brewery is just north of Dunedin, sitting on the shore of Blueskin Bay. It’s focused on brewing small batch handcrafted beers for the people of Dunedin. Its small bar has a real community flavour, regularly featuring live music and food trucks. Open on Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays. 1870 Waikouaiti-Waitati Rd, Blueskin Bay Noisy Brewing Co. Noisy Brewing Co. is a little Dunedin brewery which opened in 2018, supplying various bars around the city. You can also join the aficionados and buy Noisy brews direct from the cellar door. 7 Anzac Avenue, Central Dunedin Steamer Basin Hunt out No Name Alley and visit Steamer Basin's stylish new taproom, just off Bond Street. Steamer Basin brews using low-tech, traditional methods to make well-balanced beer that is enjoyable to share and celebrates our place. As well as their year-round beers, Steamer Basin produce small batch seasonal beers using fresh ingredients matched with delicious woodfired pizza. No Name Alley (just off Bond Street) Central Dunedin Dunedin Distilleries No.8 Distillery Tucked away in a light and airy brick building on the corner of Filleul and Hanover Streets in downtown Dunedin, No. 8 Distillery crafts a range of award-winning boutique spirits and liquors and also holds workshops and tasting sessions. Sample their range of award-winning gins, rums and other delicious drops, made with a recipe passed down by the French distillers grandmother. 4 Hanover Street, Central Dunedin Sandymount Distillery Crafting boutique gins and vodka, this Otago Peninsula-based distillery channels the beauty and wildness of the region into its locally-inspired range, made using locally foraged native botanicals among other more classic ingredients. Watch this space for news of the new tasting room opening on-site soon. 71 Sandymount Road, Otago Peninsula Dunedin Craft Distillers Located in the heart of Dunedin's historic Steamer Basin is Dunedin Craft Distillers. A small batch operation which is literally raising spirits, from bread. Created by two Dunedin women on a mission to reduce the volume of bread and bakery waste going to landfill, it's a true food upcycling success story. All their spirits are distilled from fermented waste bread and bakery products. The distillery’s range includes their signature Dunedin Dry Gin and medal winning  Cacao Vodka, The Bay Gin and Naked Spirit. Visit their refurbished brewhouse and distillery featuring traditional open fermentation and a beautiful 500L copper still. Do a tasting or take a guided tour of their unique Bread to Bottle process. Bars, Pubs and Clubs Octagon and Moray Place Mr Fox An intriguing new subterranean bar has arrived at no. 12 The Octagon, Mr. Fox is a den of cool, cocktails and tapas, tucked away below street level with a hidden courtyard space amongst the heritage buildings. Serving up signature ‘foxtails’ such as the Basil Brush Bramble, the Lost Giraffe and the Midwestern along with delicious titbits from the Bacchus kitchen upstairs, this is a bar worth trying. Woof! Woof! Is a late-night bar located on the corner of Moray Place and Lower Stuart St. An eclectic, welcoming and surprising bar experience, accompanied by great service, carefully curated spaces and top-notch music. Scottish author and cocktail writer Damian Barr has had a hand in designing the cocktail menu and musician/culinary genius Stef Animal heads up the kitchen team. Dunedin Social Club Lively spot with alfresco seating on the corner of Princes Street and the Octagon, snacks and sit-down dining, often with live music after dark – get your dance on. The Craic Irish Tavern Get snug in this cosy corner of the Octagon, offering a wide selection of international and NZ beers, wines, spirits and whiskys as well as an extensive menu for brunch, lunch and dinner. Emerson's Brew Bar A great site for people watching on the corner of the Octagon and lower Stuart Street. Albar A small Lower Stuart Street bar with lots of heart, serving local wine and beer, a select spirit range and tasty, tasty snacks. Catacombs Nightclub Find the lower Octagon doorway to this popular dance club and nightclub. CBK Bar and Kitchen Craft beer and ciders and stone grill meats, views over the Octagon plus alfresco seating. Pool House Café and Bar An enormous space with plenty of pool tables for you and your friends. Found on the Moray Place/Filluel Street corner. Pequéno Shhh, it’s a secret… cocktails, wine, tapas found down an alleyway in Upper Moray Place opposite the Rialto Cinema. Toast Bar A chill vibe with welcoming, cocktail-shakin’ staff on Princes Street. George Street Zanzibar A gin bar with so many choices they’re running out of room for glasses to serve them in. As Joni Mitchell would sing, it has 'the whoosh of jungle blades and the crackle of northern ice'. Knowledgeable staff and live music. The Bog This Irish bar and restaurant is in a classic publican’s site and hosts music and quiz nights. Hanover Street Vivace Karaoke Bar Yes, the song list has everything from Euro-pop to K-pop and everything in between. Belt it out. Near the city centre Sessions This popular inner-city haven offers fab food, local and NZ craft beer, cider and wine. Live music and a happy atmosphere add to the attraction. XYZ It’s new, there’s a big glowing dance floor, it’s LGBTQ and Straight friendly and they’re planning heaps of events. Sounds like fun. Duke of Wellington Nothing beats a classic British-style pub on a cool winter's day and the Duke of Wellington is all that and more. The purveyors of fine ales from around the globe, this rather ornate establishment in the historic Warehouse Precinct of Dunedin has twenty-odd beers on hand at any given time and a cosy, wood panelled interior that lends itself to a few warming pints and a bit of banter. North Dunedin Inch Bar It’s little, friendly, welcoming, with live music and a range of local and exotic beverages. South Dunedin The Kensington There’s a real community vibe at this classic pub, established in 1915. There’s free pool, quiz nights galore, family days when children eat for free, even Texas Holdem Poker nights. Port Chalmers The Portsider A characterful pub whose staff know the stories behind the great beer they serve with tasty food in this historic harbourside township. Carey’s Bay Hotel A landmark 1874 bluestone pub and seafood restaurant on the banks of the Otago Harbour. Settle in and relax for the day. Subscribe to our newsletters... About Us — Noisy Brewing Co. 0 Skip to Content Brewery & Taproom Menu About Shop Contact Open Menu Close Menu Brewery & Taproom Menu About Shop Contact Open Menu Close Menu Brewery & Taproom Menu About Shop Contact Small, crafty & sometimes a bit noisy. Noisy Brewing Co is a small, family operated brewery run by Chris, Sarah & little Juniper Noye, with brewer Adam Harris. Words by Kelly Tapper & Photography by Nancy Zhou via Neat Places Noisy Brewing Co. is a boutique brewing company making waves in  the Dunedin beer scene. Small and nimble, with an experimental and  innovative output by owner Chris Noye, who loves nothing more than  concocting a new brew. Noisy’s inception started at the end of 2017, after owner Chris and  his partner Sarah threw caution to the wind and quit their jobs to take a  year off. To do what? They weren’t sure.  Starting out as novice  homebrewers playing around in the kitchen, the fledgling idea for Noisy  was born after a mere 4 months. There’s no core range of beers here, instead they choose to make a  plethora of bold flavoursome brews, from porters to sours, pilsners to  pale ales - the mantra is diversification. And as the craft beer market  shifts and moves in a bid to cater to its fans, Noisy’s ethos certainly  seems in sync with the ever-changing landscape, sometimes remaking a  popular drop but not always, keeping everyone on their toes. Their shapeshifting line-up of beers have garnered Noisy a loyal  following in Dunedin, with a hoard of clientele regularly popping down  to the takeaway off-licence in Kenmure. Customers can have a chat with  Chris, sample new drops and pick up a selection of ales to take home.  You’ll also see their beers adorning taps at hospitality places across  the city, including Carey’s Bay Hotel, Ombrellos, Eureka and  Sessions Bar. Chris recently made an Imperial Stout which is now aging in whiskey  barrels for a year. For him it’s about the long burn. We certainly hope  Noisy Brewing Co. is a long burn too. 7 Anzac Ave, Dunedin 9016  •   info@noisybrew.co.nz
